content.description:
The table below shows the level of household savings at various levels of disposable income in a country.

Savings Disposable Income <math alttext="$2,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$2</mtext><mtext>,000</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="$10,000 " display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$10</mtext><mtext>,000</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="$2,200" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$2</mtext><mtext>,200</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="$12,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$12</mtext><mtext>,000</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Based on the level of savings and disposable income data in the table above, which of the following must be true?

choices.label: The marginal propensity to save is 0.2.
The marginal propensity to save is 0.9.

When disposable income is <math alttext="$12,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>12</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, consumption is <math alttext="$10,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>10</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The marginal propensity to consume is 0.1.
The marginal propensity to consume is 0.9.

content.answer: The marginal propensity to consume is 0.9.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an economic concept, principle, or model using quantitative data or calculations.
